nodes.description: Ansar al-Forqan terrorist group claims responsibility for a suicide blast in Chabahar.
nodes.support_text: Ansar al-Forqan terrorist group has reportedly claimed responsibility for the Thursday morning suicide blast in Iran's Southeastern city of Chabahar which killed at least 2 people and wounded several others.

nodes.description: A bomb blast occurs near a police station in Chabahar, killing at least 2 people and wounding several others.
nodes.support_text: A bomb blast was heard some minutes ago near a police station on a street in Chabahar city and security forces and aid groups were immediately deployed in the region.

nodes.description: Security forces and aid groups are deployed to the scene of the bomb blast.
nodes.support_text: Security forces and aid groups were immediately deployed in the region.

nodes.description: Local sources report that at least 2 law enforcement police have been killed in the attack.
nodes.support_text: Local sources also said that at least 2 law enforcement police have been killed in the terrorist attack.

nodes.description: The suicide bomber intended to reach the Law Enforcement command center but was forced to stop and detonate the bomb.
nodes.support_text: The suicide bomber meant to open his path into the Law Enforcement command center, but was forced to stop where he blew up himself and the car.

nodes.description: The Caretaker of Chabahar city's Governor-General Office confirms deaths and injuries, stating conditions are under control.
nodes.support_text: Caretaker of Chabahar city's Governor-General Office Bameri confirmed the death and injury of a number of people in the bomb blast, stressing that conditions are under control now.

nodes.description: A number of wounded people, including women, children, and local business owners, are transferred to Imam Ali (AS) hospital.
nodes.support_text: A number of women, children and local business owners are among the wounded people who were transferred to Imam Ali (AS) hospital.

nodes.description: Chabahar medical officials report that 27 wounded people have been admitted to hospitals, including a pregnant woman and a 16-year-old adolescent.
nodes.support_text: But the latest reports by Chabahar medical officials said that 27 wounded people have so far been admitted to the city's hospitals, among them a pregnant woman and a 16-year-old adolescent.

nodes.description: Commander of the Islamic Revolution Guards Corps (IRGC) Ground Force visits the blast site.
nodes.support_text: Commander of the Islamic Revolution Guards Corps (IRGC) Ground Force Brigadier General Mohammad Pakpour visited the blast site on Thursday.

nodes.description: The chief commander of Chabahar's Law Enforcement Police dismisses media claims that he was killed in the attack.
nodes.support_text: The chief commander of Chabahar's Law Enforcement Police dismissed media claims that he was killed in the terrorist attack.

nodes.description: In June 2017, the IRGC Ground Force killed the ringleader of Ansar al-Forqan in clashes in the heights of Qasr-e Qand region.
nodes.support_text: In June 2017, the IRGC Ground Force killed the ringleader of Ansar al-Forqan terrorist group, Jalil Qanbar Zehi, in clashes in the heights of Qasr-e Qand region, Southeastern Iran.

nodes.description: IRGC's public relations office announced the destruction of a Takfiri terrorist team in Qasr-e Qand, after receiving a tip-off about their presence.
nodes.support_text: IRGC's public relations office announced in a statement at the time that the IRGC Ground Force destroyed a Takfiri terrorist team in Qasr-e Qand in the Southeastern province of Sistan and Balouchestan.

nodes.description: Several terrorists were killed and wounded in clashes with the IRGC forces in Qasr-e Qand region, including the ringleader of Ansar al-Forqan.
nodes.support_text: Several terrorists were killed and wounded in clashes with the IRGC forces in Qasr-e Qand region, including the ringleader of Ansar al-Forqan, it added.

nodes.description: The IRGC's public relations office announced the destruction of a Takfiri terrorist group in Qasr-e Qand after receiving a tip-off about their presence.
nodes.support_text: The statement said that after being tipped off about the presence of a Takfiri terrorist group in Qasr-e Qand region, several units of IRGC ground troops were dispatched to the scene and attacked the terrorists.

edges.support_text: Ansar al-Forqan terrorist group has reportedly claimed responsibility for the Thursday morning suicide blast in Iran's Southeastern city of Chabahar which killed at least 2 people and wounded several others.
A bomb blast was heard some minutes ago near a police station on a street in Chabahar city and security forces and aid groups were immediately deployed in the region.
Local sources also said that at least 2 law enforcement police have been killed in the terrorist attack.
The suicide bomber meant to open his path into the Law Enforcement command center, but was forced to stop where he blew up himself and the car.
Caretaker of Chabahar city's Governor-General Office Bameri confirmed the death and injury of a number of people in the bomb blast, stressing that conditions are under control now.
A number of women, children and local business owners are among the wounded people who were transferred to Imam Ali (AS) hospital.
But the latest reports by Chabahar medical officials said that 27 wounded people have so far been admitted to the city's hospitals, among them a pregnant woman and a 16-year-old adolescent.
Commander of the Islamic Revolution Guards Corps (IRGC) Ground Force Brigadier General Mohammad Pakpour visited the blast site on Thursday.
The chief commander of Chabahar's Law Enforcement Police dismissed media claims that he was killed in the terrorist attack.

IRGC's public relations office announced in a statement at the time that the IRGC Ground Force destroyed a Takfiri terrorist team in Qasr-e Qand in the Southeastern province of Sistan and Balouchestan.
The IRGC's public relations office announced the destruction of a Takfiri terrorist group in Qasr-e Qand after receiving a tip-off about their presence.
